sub2: The choice of material depends on factors such as the number of pieces, material of the end product, product size and desired accuracy. It is important to consider the specific requirements of each project in order to select the optimum mould.
sub3: Injection moulds can be classified according to the injection method, i.e. the way in which the molten plastic material is introduced into the mould. There are essentially two main types of injection methods.
sub4: The production of undercuts in injection moulding requires special techniques and mechanisms, as they indicate areas in a moulded part that cannot be separated by simply pushing the two halves of the mould apart. Undercuts can be caused by overhanging structures or internal features, for example.
tagline: Innovation through mould making: Perfect tools for your injection moulding success.
